text: i dunno if this is the right channel to share this, but my kid (10yo) is going on a “Google Expedition” fieldtrip -

Google Expeditions is a new product that allows teachers to take their classes on virtual field trips, immersing students in experiences that bring abstract concepts to life and giving students a deeper understanding of the world beyond the classroom.
Students will take a 30 minute virtual field strip using a tablet and Google Cardboard viewers with phones for each student.
These trips are collections of virtual reality panoramas- 360 degree photo spheres, 3D images and video, ambient sounds- annotated with details, points of interest, and questions.
he’s going to “visit” the great barrier reef.
wow, that's amazing. really impressed with how well those cardboard viewers work

attachments.title: Expeditions Pioneer Program - Google
attachments.text: Bringing immersive and educational virtual reality journeys to schools, teachers, and students around the world.

text: very cool! We have a cardboard in the office somewhere..
oooh. i’d love to try it.
I gave mine to my nieces and nephews and they loved it.
ordered a pi zero to play with just now -- they finally are in stock at adafruit

attachments.title: Raspberry Pi Zero Case by adafruit
attachments.text: UPDATE 12/8/15 3pm et Version added for mounting screws. Includes threads for M2.5 and thicker stand-offs for stronger hold and secure mount. UPDATE 12/3/15 5pm et The cutouts for USB ports and miniHDMI has been opened up (0.2mm on each side) to accommodate for cables with larger connectors. The recessed area has been removed. The cutout for the SD card has been reduced and removed from the cover part. The inner lip of the cover was reduced 0.1mm to accommodate for the tight tolerance. This is a simple enclosure for the Raspberry Pi Zero. It's a two piece design that features cutouts for the GPIO, microUSB, mini HDMI and microSD card. The Raspberry Pi Zero PCB snap fits into the enclosure with no need for machine screws. The cover also has a snap fit. Designed by Noe Ruiz. Check out the tutorial on YouTube. <https://youtu.be/rnS80vaDuq0> Download Design Source <http://a360.co/1PQ28pY>
attachments.fallback: Raspberry Pi Zero Case by adafruit
